Load the necessary packages
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
library(leaps)
library(olsrr)
library(caret)
library(class)
```

Read in the data, clean variable names
```{r}
msrpDF <- clean_names(read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hmlam1/MSDS-Projects/main/Applied%20Stats%20Project%201/Vehicle_MSRP.csv', show_col_types=F))
```

Check for missing values for each variable
```{r}
colSums(is.na(msrpDF))
# cbind(lapply(lapply(cars, is.na), sum))
#engine fuel type: 3
#engine HP: 69
#engine cylinders: 30 
#Number of doors: 6

unique(msrpDF$engine_fuel_type) # remove at the end
unique(msrpDF$engine_hp) # continuous so use median for model or year for NA?
unique(msrpDF$engine_cylinders) # set as categorical, merge 0 and NA together?
unique(msrpDF$number_of_doors) # google car and input value

# clean data
msrpDF <- msrpDF %>% mutate(number_of_doors = ifelse(make == 'Tesla' & model == 'Model S' & year == 2016,4,
        ifelse(make == 'Ferrari' & model == 'FF' & year == 2013,2,number_of_doors)),
        engine_hp = ifelse(is.na(engine_hp), median(engine_hp,na.rm=TRUE), engine_hp),
        engine_cylinders = as.factor(ifelse(is.na(engine_cylinders)|engine_cylinders == 0,0,engine_cylinders)),
        highway_mpg = ifelse(highway_mpg == 354, 34, highway_mpg)) %>% 
    filter(!is.na(engine_fuel_type))
```
Confirm that there are zero NA values
```{r}
sum(as.numeric(is.na.data.frame(msrpDF)))
```
Study the data
```{r}
dim(msrpDF) # 16 variables, 11914 observations
str(msrpDF) # or spec(msrpDF) for condensed recap
summary(msrpDF)
```

### EDA
```{r}
msrpDF %>% ggplot(aes(x=year, y=msrp)) + geom_point()
# cars before 2001.
dim(msrpDF %>% select(msrp, year) %>% filter(year < 2001))
summary(msrpDF %>% select(msrp, year) %>% filter(year < 2001))
# msrp < 500000. 11 obs
dim(msrpDF %>% select(make, model, year, msrp) %>% filter(msrp > 500000))
summary(msrpDF %>% select(make, model, year, msrp) %>% filter(msrp > 500000))
```
final df
```{r}
final <- msrpDF %>% filter(year < 2001 & msrp < 10000)
summary(final)

```
